intro: Angostura cuspare, commonly known as the narrow-leaf angostura, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
